description:
A .NET implementation of the Guild Wars 2 public API.
This implementation aims to provide .NET developers with an easy to use, well documented library and tools to use in their own applications which rely on data from the Guild Wars 2 API.
We want to provider users with an entry point to the api, that does not require the user to take every api node and piece the data back himself.
releaseNotes:
This release is a small release which mostly improves the code, but also fixes some breaking errors.

Changelog:
* Converting 'Item.Type' to an auto-implemented property
* Improving support for 'WeaponDetails'
* Improving support for 'UpgradeComponentDetails'
* Improving support for 'TrinketDetails'
* Improving support for 'ToolDetails'
* Improving support for 'GizmoDetails'
* Improving support for 'GatheringToolDetails'
* Improving support for 'ContainerDetails'
* Improving support for 'ConsumableDetails' and descendants
* Improving support for 'BagDetails'
* Improving support for 'BackDetails'
* Improving support for 'ArmorDetails'
* Converting constructor for 'SkinnedItem' to 'protected'
* Adding a flag for 'WeaponDamageType.Unknown'
* Adding a flag for 'InfusionSlotTypes.None'
* Adding a flag for 'UpgradeComponentFlags.None'
* Removing API caching
* Fixing summaries for 'ItemDetails' and 'EquipmentDetails'
* Resharping; reformatting embedded xml doc comments; fixing file headers
* Renaming namespace 'Common.Types' to 'Common.Contracts' for consistency
* Adding a new property 'Item.Details' that can be cast to a specific implementation at runtime
* Adding a missing property 'GatheringTool.DefaultSkin'
* Changing JSON serializers to use configurable defaults
* Implementing support for "InfusionSlot.ItemId"
* Improving chat links support
* Implementing support for equipment with a secondary upgrade component.
* Adding missing consumable types

title: GW2.NET
